name: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa

reviews.text: After reading some bad reviews, I was nervous about checking in. We arrived early and were able to check in right away. The Lobby is beautiful and the whole complex was keep up well. You can tell this resort is fairly new. Our room was in the 5th building with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths overlooking the HWY. Everything was very clean & we had no issues at all with our room. My 3 and 1 year old slept very well!! The pool was amazing and warm in the sun, the other heated pool felt like bath water. There are 4 hot tubs total. We ate at the Irish pub, the pool bar and the pizza hut all were good. Also love being walking distance to the outlet mall. They have some good stores. We rented a car, so no need for other transportation. Walmart was literally a 5 min drive we were able to get all our groceries in one shot! We are already planning our trip back to this resort in 2 years:) Also- if you haven't been to Mickey's Christmas it was SPECTACULAR!
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Orlando in Nov 2010 with Virgin Holidays and choose this location as we had seen it on previous visits to the area. I'll admit if you're looking for somewhere with a variety of nightlife/restaurants within walking distance then this place isn't for you. But with a outlet shopping mall onsite and a great Walmart almost opposite and a Publix and Target down the road; we were sorted. Plus, it is very, very near to Disney property; it took us 7 minutes from car ignition to car park at EPCOT! Downtown Disney is just up the SR535 as is the Crossroads shopping/dining area.
reviews.title: Perfect for us - would stay again.

reviews.text: The site itself was clean and well maintained and quiet. Our appartment was in building 4 and wonderful for all our needs. (the kitchen was lacking in a few cooking utensils but that just meant we had to eat out more -shame!) Staff were helpful and polite. The pool area was well equipped with loungers/chairs and shower/toilet facilities; they also played Margaritaville radio. Excellent choice for relaxing.
reviews.title: Bad Choice!!!

reviews.text: Would stay again.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: We are frequent travelers and have visited over 50 countries. I did a lot of research before booked this so called resort. I'll start with the good. Pool is really fun, bar service very friendly, but drinks are a little pricey. Irish Pub is excellent, but not part of the hotel as you're led to believe, so you cannot charge to your account. The condo was okay, but couch and chair a little dirty & worn. They did not furnish enough towels or wash clothes and will charge you for extra. You'll need to make a trip to grocery for basics.
reviews.title: Great Place and Amazing Price

reviews.text: This place is awesome if you are visiting Disney World with your family. We got a 2 bedroom apartment for 3 adults and two children. The apartment was big. It had a full kitchen with everything one could ask for. There was also washer and dryer. Really convenient. It rained pretty much every day during our trip, hence we ended up using the room a lot!
reviews.title: Lots of space - Great choice for families

reviews.text: The locations is perfect. Really close to the Disney parks. There was indoor parking, which was very helpful since it was raining. Also, there is a mini market in one of the buildings which is handy. An outlet shopping center is located next door, you can walk there. There is a super WalMart very close to the hotel as well. In fact, there are plenty of restaurants and stores in that area.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: We did not use room services, but that is an additional service. The pool was great. The kids loved it! There was a nice pool bar as well.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
Great Value-Great Loaction-Has Great Potential With a Little Effort
reviews.text: I really recommend this resort for families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with this resort for 8 days. The room we had (Antigua, 2 bedroom) was beautiful. It was clean and nicely furnished. There was plenty of room for the 4 of us to not be on top of each other for the times we spent at the resort. My kids are 13 and 3 and they shared a bedroom. Not ideal in the 13 yr olds view...but it worked well. The public areas of the hotel were clean and clutter free and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location but expensive
Traveling in Orlando
reviews.text: This is a excellent hotel with very nice buildings and swiming pool. the rate is fair, and the room was equiped with all the stuff you might need, to stay comfortable

I booked a one bedroom suite on the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa website taking advantage of the advance booking rate which was the lowest I could find anywhere. Upon check in we were automatically upgraded to a two bedroom suite. The room was great! The full size kitchen felt like home. The jacuzzi tub was very nice after a long day of walking around the theme parks. The in-room safe was large enough to accomodate my laptop and a few small purses. The in-room washer and dryer meant that we were able to pack lighter and take more stuff home with us. We did not pay the extra fee for housekeeping and instead decided to wash our towels mid-week along with our other laundry.
reviews.title: Loved It - Great location close to all attractions & awesome accomodations

reviews.text: The resort was a short drive away from a Walmart so we were able to stock up on some groceries for the week. We received some great coupons for the outlet mall next door and did spend some time shopping there. The resort is approximately 5-15 minutes away from everything (Seaworld, Universal Studios & Disney) which made for a quick drive home each evening. The resort does offer a small grocery store but it is pretty expensive. A small package of Ramon noodles sold for $1.99 at the resort grocery store but at Walmart the same package cost $0.28. We did dine one night at the Irish pub located at the resort. The food was average, nothing special but something close and convenient.
reviews.title: Loved it except for 1 major issue

reviews.text: Overall a great place to stay for the cost. We really enjoyed the fact that we had seperate bedrooms so my daughter could go to sleep early and the adults could stay up a little later. Something that can't be done in a regular hotel room. Having the full size kitchen helped us save a significiant amount on food. We had breakfast in the room before we left each morning, lunch at the parks and dinner back at our room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and be booking my next stay in Orlando here.
reviews.title: Fantastic place
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: LBVRV&S was an awesome place to stay. We definitely will be back and I've even recommended this place to others. I didn't get a single one of those ads shoved under the door like others have said. The restaurant onsite is ok, not great, and was overpriced. I wouldn't eat there again. Staff was professional and friendly at all times. It was very clean. The beds were comfortable. We never heard a single sound from anyone in our building (2). There was not enough parking for our building though and sometimes found ourselves parking on the other side of the building and having to walk a ways. I called a few weeks before arrival and requested a ground floor room being that we have small children and they run around. I didn't want to keep yelling at them to not run(yeah right) LOL so I thought let them do it where there isn't anyone below us! So luckily my request was granted.

Our holiday started badly because we were told (at the booking stage) we were going to have a top floor apartment with a pool view, instead, we were the given the 'joke room' in building 1 floor 2, overlooking the shopping mall.The room was very worn out, kitchen cupboards empty (no pans or electrical items) and broken fittings. We couldn't sit on balcony as palm trees were overhanging. We paid for a 3bed 3bath and when we asked if we could change to another 3 bed apt we were told that the block for these rooms were all the same and were in need of renovation. Our only option was for 2 x 2bed rooms in building 5, which were slightly newer. The kitchen cooking equipment was limited. There was no bottle opener, no can opener., and only a cookie sheet for the oven. Although the pirate ship looks impressive, it is only a feature, you cannot access any of it. It has 1 slide but can only be used when lifeguard is on duty. The heating for the pool is only on sporadically. We have stayed in 5 star accommodation in Orlando and this definitely isn't one of them.
reviews.title: very disappointed and highly overated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my boyfriend and some friends in late October. We stayed in the St. Lucia Suite. 3 bedrooms (2 of the 3 bedrooms have Jacuzzi Tubs and Walk-In Showers). The third room had twin beds with a 3rd bathroom in the hall. This suite had a nice, long balcony stretching nearly the entire width of the suite. The view, however, was of the outlet shops that encompass the hotel. Honestly, this hotel was adequate. The beds were comfortable, but the furnishings in the rooms and the main room seemed dated. The master bathrooms were great with tons of closet space, if you need it. The washer dryer in the suite was a great bonus, and the kitchen was stocked with pots/pans/dishes, so that was nice.
reviews.title: Nice Enough.

reviews.text: The fitness center was nothing spectacular. You can get some cardio in, but no free weights, just a few of the weight machines. The pools were fun. Though, the towels they give you are ridiculously small. Internet service didn't work in our rooms, and I was shocked to see they charge for internet use of the hotel's computers. I thought we were passed that by now with wi-fi. Anyways, we all enjoyed our stay, however, I think the complaint we all had was the location. It's really not a pretty area. The shops make half of the hotel grounds look nice enough, but the other half (buildings 3,4,5) have grounds that are pretty abandoned, like a vacant lot or something. The location of the hotel was not ideal. Not that it was far away, but there are so many other hotels for the same price that are much closer to all the parks. We had a rental car and used it the entire time. So, long story short. The hotel didn't blow us away. The hotel buildings themselves are pretty, but the unfinished/abandoned grounds surrounding part of the hotel and the general unfinished feel of hotel itself led to a feeling of disappointment. You could do better, you could do worse.
reviews.title: Great Location and Clean

reviews.text: Stayed with wife and 3 yr old son. We had a great time at this resort. The best thing I can say of this place is the location is perfect, near disney parks, seaworld, shops, walmart, expressways, airport. It did not take long to get anywhere that we needed to go. Rooms are very clean and large, better than the small rooms at disney resorts. The pool with the pirate ship was great, it is heated, however not much so, we did go swimming at 9:00 at night and it was about 65 degrees and it was comfortable in the pool. I will say that thought the waterslide in the pirate ship is cool, it is pitch black in there and scary at first, be prepared for this. You must be 50" tall to ride by yourself, otherwise an adult can go down with a child, the landing area in the pool for the slide is 4 feet deep, so small children would not be able to touch the bottom. Some things that I did not like were the hard pillows and the thin walls. When you take a trip to disney it is extremely exhausting, alot of walking and alot to see so you need to have a good place to sleep and recharge your system, I found this place a little lacking in this department. The walls are thin, however we were so tired that this did not prevent us from sleeping. My wife did go to the spa and got a pedicure and a sea salt scrub which she said was the best that she had ever had, she was happy and as us men know when the wife is happy the whole family is happy. Had a good time, for the price and location I would definitely go back to LBVR.
reviews.title: Good value with great location

reviews.text: Very clean and large rooms. Had the family and friends down for a wedding and kids really enjoyed the large pool with the pirate ship. Was able to take the kids to the park on the last day by using the early airport check in service next door at the outlet mall. Flight departed late in the evening so this was an added benefit and no stress having to be at the airport three hours before departure.
reviews.title: Ideal for families with children

aka: Lake Buena Vista Resort Village Hotel Orlando
description: Location and amenities! Luxury one, two, three and four bedroom suites with fully equipped kitchens, private balconies, washer/dryer and more. Two pools - one with a Pirate Ship slide and pool bar. Reflections Spa~Salon and Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub onsite. Two miles to Disney and on the doorstep of Lake Buena Vista Factory Stores. Complimentary scheduled transportation to Disney, Universal, and SeaWorld.
